alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 8:49PM CST until February 20 at 12:25AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... St. Francis River near Patterson affecting Wayne County. .Heavy rainfall over the past 24 hours caused the St. Francis River at Patterson to rise above flood stage. The river should crest tonight, then begin a gradual fall, dropping below flood stage Saturday evening. For the St. Francis River...including Patterson, Fisk...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St. Francis River near Patterson. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CST Thursday the stage was 23.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
